articles.title: Antarctica Scientists "Don't Actually Have an Explanation" for Strange Radio Pulses Coming from Below the Ice - The Debrief
articles.summary: (Credit: Stephanie Wissel / Penn State) Penn State scientists using balloon-mounted cosmic particle detectors to analyze radio waves from cosmic rays on the remote continent of Antarctica report the anomalous detection of strange radio pulses that seem to originate from below the ice. A statement announcing the anomalous detections says these “bizarre signals” defy the current understanding of particle physics...
